MS MCQs

    Use Planning Optimization in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

    »

    1. Select one of the following options that best describes why Planning Optimization will run faster than built-in master planning.

      Planning Optimization has several functional enhancements that make it faster than built-in master planning.

      The database is simplified to run faster at night.

      The Planning Optimization Add-in is run in memory outside the regular system, so it runs much faster.

      Planning Optimization allows for auto-firming of planned orders.


    2. If an item’s on-hand inventory shows a total of minus 15, what will Planning Optimization do?

      Treat it as zero on-hand.

      Planning Optimization assumes it is oversold and must therefore consider it when creating a planned order.

      Planning Optimization will calculate the order quantity based on the item model group setting for physical inventory.

      Planning Optimization will calculate the order quantity based on the item model group setting for financial inventory.


    3. When a planned order is approved, what will Planning Optimization do?

      Create an actual order at that time so that it appears on the Production order, Purchase order, or Transfer order list.

      Regenerate the same order the next time Planning Optimization is run based on transactions that occur.

      The planned order will not be affected the next time Planning Optimization is run.
